text: Hello, my name is Benoit Bouffard.
I’m the Product and Marketing Director at LightOn.
AWS has enabled us to be supported by experts who have saved us a lot of time on deployment. The Activate program has enabled us to benefit

from €100,000 in credits, which has obviously enabled us to
reduce our costs
in order to initiate the entire training phase for our models.
The specialty of LightOn’s current model Alfred is that it’s been trained specifically to do what we call RAG, which means being able
to interact with a dedicated document database, which enables it to greatly reduce its hallucinations because
every time we ask it a question, it provides an answer with extracts from the document database.

Today, as part of our ongoing
process of improving our models, we are listening
to our customers, because today, given that our models are deployed in on-premises infrastructure or in private clouds, we don't
necessarily have access to how they use them. But the aim is to listen to them so that we can continually improve our models and regularly
fine-tune them with their feedback so that we always have a model that is adapted to the needs of our customers in different use cases.
It’s been a year since companies discovered the power of generative AI and its potential, and they're starting to roll out POCs.
The idea is that we're now supporting them so that they can build real scalable solutions in the middle of their day-to-day processes and have
solutions that give them concrete returns on investment.
Our experience with AWS over the last few years, with whom we’ve been lucky enough to work. The first thing is that we’re dealing with

experts who know what they’re talking about and know how to support
us and answer our questions. Secondly, they have an infrastructure
and an interface that are extremely easy to use and scalable. In other words, they've been able to support us as we've gone along,
in a way that's allowing us to grow quite quickly.
We never have to worry about availability in this respect.
